natural problem: Find the phase shift of the graph of $y =  2 \sin \left( x + \frac{\pi}{3} \right).$
natural solution: Since the graph of $y = 2 \sin \left( x + \frac{\pi}{3} \right)$ is the same as the graph of $y = 2 \sin x$ shifted $\frac{\pi}{3}$ units to the left, the phase shift is $\boxed{-\frac{\pi}{3}}.$ [asy]import TrigMacros;

size(400); real g(real x) { 	return 2*sin(x + pi/3); } real f(real x) { 	return 2*sin(x); } draw(graph(g,-3*pi,3*pi,n=700,join=operator ..),red); draw(graph(f,-3*pi,3*pi,n=700,join=operator ..)); trig_axes(-3*pi,3*pi,-3,3,pi/2,1);

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * sin (x + pi / 3)"
shows  "phase_shift f = - pi / 3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find the phase shift of the graph of $y =  2 \sin \left( x + \frac{\pi}{3} \right).$ The final Answer is -\frac{\pi}{3}
 ### Proof
 Since the graph of $y = 2 \sin \left( x + \frac{\pi}{3} \right)$ is the same as the graph of $y = 2 \sin x$ shifted $\frac{\pi}{3}$ units to the left, the phase shift is $\boxed{-\frac{\pi}{3}}.$ [asy]import TrigMacros;
 size(400); real g(real x) { 	return 2*sin(x + pi/3); } real f(real x) { 	return 2*sin(x); } draw(graph(g,-3*pi,3*pi,n=700,join=operator ..),red); draw(graph(f,-3*pi,3*pi,n=700,join=operator ..)); trig_axes(-3*pi,3*pi,-3,3,pi/2,1);
 layer(); rm_trig_labels(-5, 5, 2); [/asy]
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real and f :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. f x = 2 * sin (x + pi / 3)"
shows  "phase_shift f = - pi / 3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Find the phase shift of the function $f(x) = 2 * sin (x + \pi / 3)$. The final answer is $-\pi / 3$.
